hints.content: First, let's find the length of each pencil.

All of the pencils begin at $0\text{ cm}$ on the ruler.  So, we can look at where our pencils end on the ruler to find their length.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fb5e6ad1f66aaf158618f7ea3dd28272dc68d13d)

$\redE{\text{Pencil A}}$ measure $\redE{5}$ cm long.

$\blueE{\text{Pencil B}}$ measure $\blueE{5}$ cm long.

$\goldE{\text{Pencil C}}$ measure $\goldE{3}$ cm long.

$\purpleD{\text{Pencil D}}$ measure $\purpleD{2}$ cm long.

Now, let's graph the measures on the line plot.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d44726b7f4ff5a50116f15dcb2af2f0620fc8156)

question.content:
The lengths of $4$ pencils are measured below.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fb5e6ad1f66aaf158618f7ea3dd28272dc68d13d)

**Record the length of each pencil on the line plot.**  
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each measurement.*
